greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of multimin factorizations of n.
comment: A multimin factorizations of n is an ordered factorization of n into factors greater than 1 such that the sequence of minimal primes dividing each factor is weakly increasing.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: a(1) = 1; a(n > 1) = Sum_{d|(n/p)} a(d), where p is the smallest prime dividing n.
program: (PARI) A317545(n) = if(1==n,1,my(spf = factor(n)[1,1]); sumdiv(n/spf,d,A317545(d))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 10 2018

A317545(n) = if(1==n,1,if(mapisdefined(memo317545, n), mapget(memo317545, n), my(spf = factor(n)[1,1], v = sumdiv(n/spf,d,A317545(d))); mapput(memo317545, n, v); (v))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 10 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 31 2018
